intro: Stenogyne sessilis var. hanaulaensis, commonly known as the Hanaula false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and dark green color. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare species within its native range.
